intro: Amsinckia longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed fennel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow and occur in clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Amsinckia longituba is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
